channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous vehicle double yellow, 17th August
item.description:
Regularly this van/lorry parks on the double yellow lines obstructing the view of the junction. This is causing near misses on car accidents and is a matter of time before someone is severely injured. It is very dangerous. It’s always here evening

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Wyncham Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture( desk chair, cupboard)clothes bags and fridge freezer, 17th August
item.description:
The desk chair, broken cupboard and fridge freezer have been here for more that one month. They are on the pavement. Also the people are beginning to leave clothes bag and more rubbish around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Same streets, 17th August
item.description:
Hey These people they keep doing these everywhere

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49-50, Kendal Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Outside 41 Langley road BR34AE, 17th August
item.description:
The two tree supports have been kicked or pulled out by hooligans and are lying on the ground, the new tree has lost its support.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langley Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Gas canisters left on pavement and in abandoned car, 17th August
item.description:
Gas canisters left on side of road. Car appearing abandoned also left and filled with empty canisters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Road, Blendon, London

item.title: Gas canisters and other rubbish dumped, 17th August
item.description:
A car of young people threw the rubbish out their car on Wednesday 13th 7:20pm. It includes numerous gas canisters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Penhill Road, Blendon, London

item.title: Too many Lime bikes!, 17th August
item.description:
The picture says it all - the road is filled with lime bikes creating an eyesore and obstructing residents. We just don’t need this many, please come and clear these away. Ridiculous!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Statham Grove, Stoke Newington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste left out on street, 17th August
item.description:
Food waste constantly left stacked loose on street outside numbers 18 median road leading to vermin and flies. Can we remind people that food waste bins are available? Additionally household sacks left out and collection day is Friday - pls collect before

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Median Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Rubbish dumped. Looks terrible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middle Park Avenue, Middle Park, London

item.title: Plastic bags Somertrees Avenue SE12 0BS, 17th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dilhorne Close, Chinbrook, London

item.title: Fly tipping of garden waste, carpets and a bag with meat bones!, 17th August
item.description:
This part of Eltham Palace Road is a notorious dumping ground for flytipping. I a have seen a lot dumped there over the years, but I have never seen anything like it. A large bag of what looks like meat bones has been dumped on the pavement. It’s hot and the flies are all over it and it’s started to smell. It’s next to dumped garden waste and carpet off-cuts I don’t understand why you cannot deal with these people?!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eltham Palace Road, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dead tree branch hanging in tree, 17th August
item.description:
It’s hard to see, but there is a large tree branch just hanging in the tree. It’s detached from the main trunk/broken off. I am worried that with a strong wind it may come loose and hurt someone. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London

item.title: General waste dumped on street, 17th August
item.description:
